objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) is the author and publisher of this report, providing analysis and recommendations regarding the Hexed Noodle Android malware.

objects.name: C2 domain
objects.description: Primary command and control (C2) domain used by Hexed Noodle for beaconing, tasking, and exfiltration.

objects.name: C2 domain
objects.description: Alternative command and control (C2) domain used by Hexed Noodle.

objects.name: C2 beacon URL
objects.description: Example C2 beacon URL used by Hexed Noodle for device information exfiltration.

objects.name: C2 exfiltration URL
objects.description: Example C2 exfiltration URL used by Hexed Noodle for uploading files and SMS messages.

objects.name: C2 tasking URL
objects.description: Example C2 tasking URL used by Hexed Noodle to retrieve commands from the C2 server.

objects.name: C2 task acknowledgement URL
objects.description: Example C2 URL used by Hexed Noodle to acknowledge receipt of tasking from the C2 server.

objects.name: Monitored directory
objects.description: Primary user storage area on Android devices scanned by Hexed Noodle for files to exfiltrate.

objects.name: flist.ldb
objects.description: File storing MD5 hashes of filenames/dates to avoid duplicate file exfiltration by Hexed Noodle.
objects.pattern: [file:name = 'flist.ldb' AND file:parent_directory_ref.path LIKE '(not specified, likely app data directory)']

objects.name: slist.ldb
objects.description: File storing MD5 hashes of SMS time/folder/addresses to avoid duplicate SMS exfiltration by Hexed Noodle.
objects.pattern: [file:name = 'slist.ldb' AND file:parent_directory_ref.path LIKE '(not specified, likely app data directory)']

objects.name: Indicator for KisaAndroidSecurity.apk (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious Android backdoor masquerading as a security app.

objects.name: Indicator for KisaAndroidSecurity.apk (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the malicious Android backdoor masquerading as a security app.

objects.name: Indicator for KisaAndroidSecurity.apk (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious Android backdoor masquerading as a security app.

objects.name: Indicator for Kisa Vaccine.apk (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 hash of the malicious Android backdoor variant masquerading as a security app.

objects.name: Indicator for Kisa Vaccine.apk (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 hash of the malicious Android backdoor variant masquerading as a security app.

objects.name: Indicator for Kisa Vaccine.apk (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 hash of the malicious Android backdoor variant masquerading as a security app.

objects.name: hexed noodle
objects.description: Hexed Noodle is an Android variant of the AppleSeed backdoor, masquerading as a (South) Korean Internet Security Agency (KISA) mobile security app. It performs execution of shell commands, collects filesystem contents and SMS messages, and communicates with a C2 server using predictable HTTP POST URI schemes. The malware creates three primary tasks: command beaconing, SMS monitoring, and file monitoring. It exfiltrates files and SMS messages, stores configuration as hex encoded strings with a 16 byte XOR-key prefix, and compresses data before encryption. The malware is designed to target security-conscious South Korean users and is similar in behavior to the Windows AppleSeed backdoor.

objects.name: appleseed
objects.description: AppleSeed is a backdoor malware family previously observed in Windows environments and now seen in Android variants such as Hexed Noodle. It is known for masquerading as security software and using predictable HTTP POST URI schemes for C2 communication. AppleSeed variants store configuration as hex encoded strings with a 16 byte XOR-key prefix and compress data before encryption.

objects.name: KISA
objects.description: The Korea Internet & Security Agency (KISA) is impersonated by the Hexed Noodle malware, which masquerades as a KISA mobile security app to target South Korean users.

objects.name: Operation Cobra Venom
objects.description: Operation Cobra Venom refers to a campaign in 2019 in which the AppleSeed backdoor was used, masquerading as computer security software. The campaign targeted users by disguising malware as legitimate security applications.

objects.name: dexstrings_plaincomms_obfushex_a9ff1e
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule dexstrings_plaincomms_obfushex_a9ff1e {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Plaintext strings from a Hexed Noodle 'classes.dex'
file"
        hash = "a9ff1ebb548f5bba600d38e709ff331749fa9971"

    strings:
        $exfil1 = "multipart/form-data; boundary=$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$$"
        $exfil2 = "Content-Disposition: form-data; name=\"binary\";
filename=\""
        $reqFormatAParam1 = /\?m=[a-d]&p1=/
        $reqFormatAParam2 = /&p2=[a-c]/
        $smsdb = "slist.ldb" //"flist.ldb" (name of the files db) is
obfuscated but the developers have forgotten to wrap this sms database
filename

    condition:
        3 of them
}

objects.name: Masquerade as Legitimate Application
objects.description: Hexed Noodle masquerades as a KISA mobile security app

objects.name: Gather Victim Host Information
objects.description: Hexed Noodle beacons contain device hardware information and phone number

objects.name: Unix Shell
objects.description: Hexed Noodle system commands are executed by passing them to ‘sh -c’

objects.name: User Execution
objects.description: The user is required to install the Hexed Noodle APK, accept permissions and launch the app

objects.name: Broadcast Receivers
objects.description: Hexed Noodle subscribes to BOOT_COMPLETED, MY_PACKAGE_REPLACED, SMS_RECEIVED and PACKAGE_INSTALL broadcasts

objects.name: Boot Autostart
objects.description: The Hexed Noodle app starts on receipt of the BOOT_COMPLETED notification

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information
objects.description: Hexed Noodle configuration is stored in the app as hex encoded strings containing a 16 byte XOR-key prefix – in common with other AppleSeed variants.

objects.name: Archive Collected Data Via Library
objects.description: Hexed Noodle data is Zip compressed before encryption using standard libraries

objects.name: Capture SMS Messages
objects.description: Hexed Noodle collects SMS messages and certain filesystem documents

objects.name: Data from Local System
objects.description: Hexed Noodle collects both stored and incoming SMS messages, possibly enabling the bypass of SMS-based two-factor authentication

objects.name: Automated Collection
objects.description: Hexed Noodle regularly scans file and SMS directories for changes to trigger exfiltration

objects.name: File and Directory Discovery
objects.description: Hexed Noodle contains a command to list filesystem contents

objects.name: Web Protocols
objects.description: Hexed Noodle uses HTTP requests for tasking and exfiltration

objects.name: Data Transfer Size Limits
objects.description: Hexed Noodle uploads files in chunks of at most 10MB

objects.name: Exfiltration over C2 Channel
objects.description: Hexed Noodle exfiltration and tasking are HTTP POST requests to the same server with different parameters

objects.name: Data Encrypted
objects.description: Hexed Noodle exfiltrated data is encrypted, prepended with the 16 byte XOR key and Hex encoded

objects.name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
objects.description: Hexed Noodle exfiltrates data using HTTP POST requests

objects.name: SMS Control
objects.description: Hexed Noodle enables the operator to send SMS messages from the victim device

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Hexed Noodle
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. hexed noodle.
